title: TCP vs UDP
subject: Computer Networks
theory:
- **TCP**: Reliable, Ordered, Heavy. 3-Way Handshake. (Web, Email).
- **UDP**: Unreliable, Unordered, Fast. Fire and Forget. (Video Streaming, VoIP, DNS).

common_mistakes.correction: UDP is CRITICAL for real-time apps where latency > perfect data. (e.g., Zoom lag vs glitch).

interview_questions.question: What is 3-Way Handshake?
interview_questions.answer: Connection establishment in TCP. SYN -> SYN/ACK -> ACK.
